text:
Most LinkedIn profiles are boring.

Stand out & optimize yours with these 7 tips:

Your profile is your online brand. Make it shine.

1. Colors & Fonts:
↳ Choose the right colors and fonts. 
Use this free GPT tool to find yours: https://lnkd.in/dps7m-HC 

2. Profile Picture: 
↳ Use an HD 1080 x 1080 photo. Make it smiley with a clear background.
Try this AI tool: Flux, to generate your professional headshot: https://lnkd.in/gkSwZhaE.

3. Banner: 
↳ Get an HD 1584 x 396 px banner that says one thing. 
If you pay for LinkedIn, consider a slideshow. It grabs attention.

4. Headline: 
↳ Make your headline your mission, with a twist. 
My mission: “How to create content with AI.” 
My headline: “Write your first post on LinkedIn.” 
Keep it clear.

5. Featured Section: 
↳ Include one link, big text, and no description. 
Avoid putting your best posts here. 
It’s better to have fewer clicks for more conversions.

6. About Section: 
↳ I don’t have one. 
It’s faster for people to see my featured section. 
Share who you are in your experience section instead.

7. Experience Section: 
↳ Make it detailed. Write a lot here. 
When people search “Who is Anisha Jain?”, they see my experience tab on LinkedIn. 

8. Get Premium LinkedIn: 
↳ This gives you a special link under your name when posting. 
More links mean more clicks and more conversions.

Anisha and I wrote a guide to go from 0 to 10,000 followers.

To access it, simply click here → how-to-lkdn.ai
